Commercial Sales Executive

Company Name Unisys Company Location Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About us

Unisys is a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions for the most digitally demanding businesses and governments on Earth. Unisys offerings include security software and services; digital transformation and workplace services; industry applications and services; and innovative software operating environments for high-intensity enterprise computing. For more information on how Unisys builds better outcomes securely for its clients across the Government, Financial Services and Commercial markets, visit: www.unisys.com.


About the role


Reporting to the Asia Pacific Vice President, Commercial Sales, we are currently looking to appoint a Commercial Sales Executive. Based at our Corporate Headquarters in Rhodes, this newly created role in Australia will be responsible for selling into new logo accounts across the Retail, Construction, Gas or Utilities sector on a full portfolio basis. You will plan, organize, lead and control balanced sales growth, and develop and manage a qualified opportunity pipeline. Using an existing network of contacts, you will sell a range of IT Outsourcing Managed Services solutions.

The Commercial Sales Executive is expected to identify and close complex sales opportunities across an assigned geography. As a brand ambassador for Unisys, you will prepare sales and relationship strategies, financial committee materials, executive level prospect presentations and business transformation deals that result in new and improved ways for clients to do business.


About you


With relevant tertiary qualifications, our ideal candidate is an ambitious IT Solution sales professional, with experience gained working across Retail, Construction, Utilities or Oil & Gas clients. With a proven track record in qualifying and pursuing new opportunities, you are conversant with Data Centre Transformation, Application modernization, Outsourcing and End-User services. The ability to work across a complex matrix organization is vital, as is your deep understanding of the marketplace and industry sector in which you operate.


If you are a suitably skilled individual who has the ability and drive to succeed in a busy and rewarding working environment, please click on the "Apply Now" button below. Please note, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.


Unisys is an equal opportunity employer and fosters an inclusive culture that embraces differences and diversity. We welcome applications from all sections of society.


To be eligible to apply for this position you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa. \xa0

Company Name Amadeus IT Pacific Company Location L 7, 180 Thomas st , Haymarket, NSW 2000, AU

Job description

\xa0

About the division


The Amadeus Search Shopping and Pricing (SSP) division develops products designed to serve multiple customer segments: providers (airlines, alliances, and railway operators), distributors (travel agencies, online travel agencies, tour operators) and new intermediaries (meta-search). The market in which this division operates is really competitive and innovation is crucial.


The platform supporting these processes are of massive scale in infrastructure (100 000 cores computing the transactions), in operations (25 000 transactions per second), in data (350 million of fares, petabyte scale historical data sets), in software (23 million lines of code).


Within the Search Shopping and Pricing (SSP) Division, the Sustaining Production & Maintenance department in in charge of SSP Production Maintenance, reducing incoming flow, doing Production monitoring, Follow the Sun and on call management. The main objective of this organization is to improve customer satisfaction and to achieve that, this group is in relationship with all SSP groups, R&D groups working with SSP and our BUs counterparts.


About the role


We are looking for a software engineer to join a brand new team Sydney based; this team will be our relay for all Incidents concerning our Pacific customers; this team will be also our main relay with the Operations group in charge of our Production code load.

You will be the first point of contact managing Incidents for Pacific customers, doing first investigations and being the main interface between customers or commercial organizations and Maintenance teams. Also, you will be this first point of contact for Operations teams during code load operations, ensuring code load is going well.


Your major responsibilities will be:

  • Ensure good communication within SSP through regular project status meetings and reports
  • Ensure production integrity by prioritizing reported problems
  • Interface and communicate with Operations
  • Interface and communicate with development teams inside SSP and in other R&D organizations
  • Understand business requirements or customers’ expectations in collaboration with Product Manager, Product Owner, Business Analyst and Product Definition
  • Assess development effort
  • Develop and fix software in C++, C or Java
  • Conduct unit testing, integration testing and performance testing
  • Customer satisfaction mindset


What you will bring:

  • Software Engineer base competencies: Assess development effort, understand specifications, Development skills, Unit, integration and performance tests, Technical documentation
  • Specific competencies: excellent communication skills, Excellent Reporting, Analytic thinking, Creativity Persuasion/Negotiation
  • Shopping and Pricing knowledge and experience
  • Industry compliancy
  • Experience on large and complex projects
  • 2 + years ideally on Airlines industry


If you would like to be actively involved into Incidents managements for our Pacific

customers, join us!


How to apply

To apply online please visit www.amadeus.com/careers citing LinkedIn as your source.



Please check\xa0out the jobs and apply through\xa0Amadeus career web page: www.amadeus.com/careers citing\xa0LinkedIn as your source.

All applicants must be eligible to work in Australia.
\xa0\xa0

Recruitment agencies: Amadeus does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Amadeus employees or any other company location. Amadeus is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Brighton East | Room Leader | Nursery

Company Name Only About Children Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 46 minutes ago

Job description

About The Company

About the company Only About Children (Oac) is one of Australia’s leading early education and preschool providers for children 0-5 years with a focus on integrated and holistic early childhood education, child development and health and well being. We have over 60 Early Education and Preschool campuses with many more in development throughout Sydney and Melbourne.

What makes us different?

Children are at the heart of our brand and we believe in the positive impact we can have on their overall education and wellbeing. This is no ordinary child care. At Oac, we offer 21st century childcare to meet the needs of today’s families. We focus on innovation, development and passion for education. We invite curiosity, discovery and forward thinking.

Our proposition is different and so is our attitude. We’re passionate, happy knowledgeable and approachable. Critical to our success are the great people who work here and the relationships they share with children and families.

About The Role

Our Brighton East Campus is looking to welcome a Diploma Qualified Room Leader to join our fun and friendly team. To join us, you will need to be a passionate educator, ready and willing to lead by example. Mentoring and coaching others will be a key focus of the role, as will developing strong relationships with our children, families and your colleagues. We're really after educators who have a passion for the Early Years. Understand and want to give children the best start to their lives and work with Educators, families and the wider community!

If you ready to consider new concepts. If you're up for the challenge, we'd love to hear from you!

About Our Campus

Children can enjoy the full benefits of interacting with nature thanks to our well-equipped outdoor play area, which includes a bike track, sustainable vegetable garden, ergonomic play hills, and much more. The creativity-inspiring space continues indoors with beautiful and bright interiors, all designed to make children's early learning experience as stimulating as possible.

Requirements
  • Completed Diploma of Children's Services
  • Minimum 2 years experience in a Room Leader role
  • Strong understanding of the National Quality Framework and EYLF with proven results
  • A dynamic personality, creativity and a clear passion for early childhood education
  • Ability to think "outside the square" - we push boundaries and challenge the norm!
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • A cooperative team player who loves and respects children in all their individuality and developmental stages
  • Commitment to excellence in early childhood
If this is you, then we'd love to
  • Give you a challenge - we want you to make a positive impact
  • Help you grow - we actively invest in career growth and progression
  • Provide you with benefits - we provide discounted childcare
  • Celebrate your achievements - we love to recognise great work
If you're interested simply apply online now or contact Mandy Mansourpour on 03 85295028. Alternatively you can email me on mandym@oac.edu.au

Successful applicants must have a valid Working With Children Check

Registered Psychiatric Nurse

Company Name The University of Alabama at Birmingham - School of Nursing Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Description
  • Full Time, Part Time and Casual Positions
  • Psychiatric Nurses (RPN2)
  • Mental Health Department
  • Excellent benefits, including salary packaging

About The Mental Health Department

St Vincent’s is proud of its International reputation for delivery of Mental Health Services and the use of the ‘Strengths Model’ and its principles. The Mental Health Service includes a 44 bed adult acute inpatient unit for the cities of Yarra and Boroondara; the Koori state-wide Inpatient Mental Health Service; Continuing Care Teams; a Crisis Assessment Team; ED Mental Health and Psychiatric Triage; Prevention and Recovery Care Service (PARC); Footbridge Community Care Unit; The Primary Intervention Care Team (PICT) and HOPE (suicide prevention); Mobile Support Teams; Clarendon Homeless Outreach Psychiatric Service (CHOPS); Victorian Dual Diagnosis Service (VDDS); Body Image Eating Disorders Treatment and Recovery Service (BETRS) and NEXUS (Concurrent Mental Illness and Substance Use Advisory Service); Consultation & Liaison Service and Victorian Transcultural Mental Health (VTMH) and NEVIL Training Cluster. We work collaboratively with peer workers, consumer and carer-consultants and the Aboriginal Liaison Officer. Everyone receives training in Strengths and support to participate in Productive Ward and Safewards.

Why work in Mental Health at St Vincent’s
  • We passionately believe in a recovery approach, based on people’s personal strengths
  • We believe that people have the capacity to recover, reclaim and transform their lives
  • We nurture and develop our staff with great opportunities for training and career progression
  • Our work in this field is internationally recognised
  • We believe that the preferred setting for our work is in the community and that the community is an oasis of resources
  • You will join a cohesive, supportive team, committed to the wellbeing of colleagues and consumers
  • Great location, with easy access to public transport and to the city of Melbourne with trams, buses and trains on the doorstop of the hospital and a vibrant, active social scene close by

About The Role

Opportunities currently exist for Psychiatric Nurses (RPN2) to work in Mental Health at St Vincent’s. You will provide a high standard of care in accordance with the Strengths model under a recovery oriented framework working closely with the medical and multidisciplinary teams to achieve a positive outcome for all consumers and their families. You will be offered a range of learning opportunities to develop specialist skills and the opportunity to operate as part of an integrated Adult Area Mental Health Service.

Duties
  • Work within the Strengths Model of Recovery Oriented Practice
  • Uphold a culture of hope by using optimistic language supporting consumers and celebrating their recovery efforts
  • Work with consumers to support and sustain existing resources, assets, networks and relationships and to access opportunities, resources and services to achieve their recovery goals
  • Provide education about medication, self-help, coping strategies and symptom management
  • Practice within a recovery framework promoting consumer directed care

Benefits
  • Salary packaging
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Staff Health Centre
  • Staff gym open 24 hours a day

How To Apply

St Vincent’s encourages interested applicants to contact us regarding this position; sites visits are welcome prior to interviews. Please contact Brandon Smith on 9231 4673 or Hannah Stephenson on 9231 4403 for further information.

All appointments are made subject to the candidate providing a current satisfactory National Police Certificate conducted by The Victoria Police.

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Job description

  • Excellent opportunity for passionate professionals
  • See the world while doing what you love
  • Competitive salary and benefits


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer nearly 500 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

As a large successful vocational training provider, we work across the globe with major projects in Asia, The Pacific, and the Middle East. Our tailored collaborative training models and consultancies are selected by many governments and educational institutes worldwide. For more information on our work, please visit our website:
  • Accounting
  • Biotechnology
  • Building & Construction
  • Computer Network Management & Information Technology Software Applications
  • Electrical
  • ELICOS
  • Engineering (Mechatronics, Welding Technician)
  • Graphic Design
  • Health & Community Services (Individual Support, Public Safety)
  • Hospitality
  • Industrial Electronics
  • Refrigeration and Air Conditioning
  • Renewable Energy & Engineering Technology
  • Training and Assessment (TAE)

We are also interested to hear from experienced Senior Educators; Instructional Designers; and Project Managers with an interest in working abroad or on major projects for Chisholm.

About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualification in:
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment TAE40116 or TAE40110 with a plan to meet the 2019 ASQA requirements
  • Vocational qualifications at AQF level
  • Vocational currency as demonstrated through a range of work related experience


OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Expressions of Interest should include:
  • A detailed covering letter
  • curriculum vitae including qualifications, work history and countries of work experience

  • valid Employee Working With Children Check

  • certified copies of qualifications

If your experience and skill are suitable, you will be contacted by Chisholm Institute when positions become available.

Please note: this is an expression of interest only. Where positions are advertised by Chisholm, individuals will still need to apply.

Release Manager

Company Name Saab Australia Company Location 21 Third Avenue Technology Park, Mawson Lakes, SA 5095, AU

New Posted Date Posted 22 hours ago Number of views 32 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

What you will be a part of

Saab Australia manages a common 9LV Combat Management System (CMS) product which is delivered into multiple customer projects on a number of naval ship platforms. The purpose of this role is to coordinate the release activities of the CMS Product to the various projects and ensure all the artefacts required to support the releases are delivered in accordance with the agreed schedule.


Key duties will include, but will not be limited to:

  • Consolidating and prioritising all the project(s) needs contributing to a release and proposing a schedule that considers the project and resource constraints (people and equipment).
  • Identifying and managing dependencies between projects and the Product contributing to a release.
  • Developing and maintaining the build and release plan for the 9LV CMS and managing change to the defined scope of work for the releases.
  • Identifying the set of artefacts to be delivered for the release (SW, HW, ILS), linking in with the team responsible for delivering them, and whilst following quality gate processes, monitoring progress towards delivery
  • Coordinating availability of test sites and resources to support verification activities.
  • Developing and maintaining good working relationships with internal stakeholders, ensuring they are well briefed on the release plans and progress.


Your skills and experience
  • Tertiary qualifications in systems engineering, computer science, or related technical discipline.
  • Extensive experience in the development and/or leadership of large software projects.
  • Demonstrated understanding of the lifecycle of large software development projects.
  • Proven ability in internal customer liaison.
  • Experience in producing and reviewing technical documentation against appropriate software standards.
  • Experience in the verification and acceptance testing of a software intensive system, in particular software systems for the Australian Defence customer.
  • Well developed communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to coordinate broad team activities
  • A current Defence Security Clearance to the level of NV1 is highly desirable


Applications

Click ‘Apply for this job’ to submit your application by 7 October 2018. You may contact Josh Deane for a copy of the full position description.

\xa0

Please note that this role will be initially offered as a 3 year fixed term contract.


To work at Saab you must comply with Defence Industry security requirements (i.e. you will be an Australian citizen or able to meet eligibility requirements).


Saab Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply.


Saab Australia is a proud supporter of the Veterans’ Employment Program and welcomes the interest of ex-service members, veterans and their families.

  3. Possess a deep understanding of content knowledge in their subject area;
  4. Seek to build the cohesion and effectiveness of their Faculty team; and
  5. Assist their Faculty Head in providing strategic leadership that supports College-wide initiatives.

\xa0

Additional Responsibilities

\xa0

Assist your Head of Faculty with/to:


  • Strategic thinking for the development of programs and the implementation of pedagogical initiatives identified as College priorities
  • Ensure that the knowledge, skills, attitudes and scope and sequence of learning outlined in programmes comply with NESA requirements
  • Develop high quality curriculum, assessment and reporting programs and registers
  • Managing and running Co-curricular for the Faculty, and overseeing subject change, events and PD (in absence of Head Faculty)
  • Managing/overseeing mark books
  • Drive a culture of excellence in teaching
  • Oversee the effective and efficient running of all assessments within the subject area/s
  • Champion the College Performance Feedback system, including undertaking lesson observations in consultation with Head of Faculty
  • Co-ordinate and oversee a Faculty budget
  • Chair Faculty staff meetings and managing staffing (in absence of Head of Faculty)
  • Oversee Health and Safety matters within the Faculty, including adherence to College policy and procedure, and identifying, assessing and controlling hazards within Faculty teaching areas

\xa0

Any other matters as directed by the Headmaster.

\xa0

Skills / Knowledge / Attributes

\xa0

  • A regularly practising member of a Christian Church
  • Demonstrated understanding and articulation of what learning looks like in both the Faculty and classroom, how to promote it, and equip teachers to achieve high levels of understanding amongst students
  • Demonstrated excellence as a classroom practitioner with the ability to teach the subject at Higher School Certificate level
  • Excellent communicator, displays ‘emotional intelligence’
  • Highly-developed organisation skills
  • Commitment to own on-going professional development and learning
  • Personal and professional flexibility, motivation and initiative
  • Demonstrated ability to appropriately approach and resolve conflict

\xa0

To apply for this role, submit your Cover Letter, CV and College Application form (which must form part of your application) to employment@wcc.nsw.edu.au by the closing date.

\xa0

Applications for this role close midday, Monday 15 October 2018.

\xa0

Principal Advisor – Government Relations

Company Name Rio Tinto Company Location Canberra, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Principal Advisor – Government Relations
  • Challenging and exciting role
  • Spearhead Rio Tinto lead on government relations within Australia
  • Based in Canberra, Australia

About The Role

We are looking for a Principal Advisor – Government Relations to coordinate and implement Rio Tinto’s strategy, designed to leverage the company’s operational strength, people, partnerships, investor base and reputation in Australia for superior stakeholder engagement, advocacy and performance.

This is a great opportunity for the incumbent take ownership of a pivotal role, implementing the ongoing development and maintenance of systems and processes for the delivery of key components of the Australia Strategy for Government Relations.

Reporting to the Chief Advisor – Government Relations and working closely with the wider Corporate Relations team across Australia, you will be
  • Supporting the Australia Steering Committee (Steer-Co) and Australia Strategy Working Group
  • Supporting the delivery of successful stakeholder engagement plans, including with high-quality briefing materials
  • Tracking and reporting progress against Australia Strategy metrics
  • Managing research and special projects to assist in informing and shaping the Australia Strategy
  • Supporting the delivery of successful communications strategies focusing on Rio Tinto’s contribution to Australia
  • Coordinating meetings and key events associated with the Australia Strategy.
  • Development and Maintenance of Rio Tinto’s
    • Australia-wide contributions databank (data and case studies)
    • Key stakeholder and partnerships databank
    • Detailed stakeholder engagement plans for senior Australian-based executives and Group executives as required, including integration with global stakeholder management systems
    • Nation-wide risk register.
  • As and when required lead research projects and reporting consistent with Group objectives.

About You

To be successfully considered for this role, you will have
  • Tertiary qualification in communications or a related field
  • Demonstrated experience in stakeholder analysis, engagement and planning.
  • Ability to work collaboratively across teams as well as independently to deliver business wide initiatives
  • Demonstrated experience in project managing, and working through a networked organisation in achieving results.
  • Demonstrated experience in crafting and delivering strategies, and ability to drive technical excellence in government relations
  • Experience and effective influencing skills when engaging with senior leaders internally and externally

It will also be beneficial if you have
  • Previous experience in the area of developing and implementing stakeholder engagement plans
  • Good understanding on dealing with government bodies, especially pertaining to resource sectors

Where you will be working

Corporate Relations is a global team providing expertise and advice across all aspects of external affairs, stakeholder engagement, social risk management, communication, brand management and media relations.

About Us

As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.

Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents. Aluminium and copper, diamonds, gold and industrial minerals, iron ore, coal and uranium our materials make up the world around us. You’ll find then in smartphones, planes, cars, hospitals and throughout your home.

Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce

We are a diverse team of talented, enthusiastic individuals who foster a culture of inclusion. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organization and fulfilling career.

Apply before 10th October 2018 if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.

Please note, in order to be successfully considered for a role you must complete all pre-screening questions.

  • Oil & Energy

884798225:
[

Project Staff Opportunities – Handa Opera on Sydney Harbour: West Side Story

Company Name Opera Australia Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Opera Australia\xa0is Australia's national opera company, dedicated to enriching Australia's cultural life with exceptional opera and sustaining and developing the art form, with over 600 opera performance a year. The Company works with leading directors and designers, and employs a large number of highly skilled people in the areas of scenic construction and painting, wardrobe and wig-making, stage production, management and administration.


In 2019, West Side Story takes the iconic stage at Handa Opera on Sydney Harbour. The purpose built opera house will accommodate a 31m x 30m stage, two sound and lighting towers and an access walkway on Farm Cove. Fleet Steps will house a seating structure for approximately 3,000 people, four general admission catering areas, a platinum dining area, public amenities and backstage facilities. The purpose built venue will host 26 performances with the venue opening to ticket holders from 5pm for a 7.30pm performance.


Performances are held Tuesday to Sunday, commencing at 7.30pm to approximately 10.10pm (subject to production) with one 35 minute interval. Opening night is 22 March and closing 21 April 2019.


OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE:


Site & Technical Production Coordinator: 15/10/2018 to 31/05/2019

The Site & Technical Production Coordinator is responsible for supporting the Senior Site & Technical Production Manager in the development and successful implementation of projects produced by the team to high artistic and technical standards.The role will assist the Production Manager with the management of the production operations for projects as required.The Site & Technical Production Coordinator is also responsible for supporting the Site & Venue Operations Manager in coordinating the site and venue requirements for projects as required.The role may also support projects for other business units.

For more information about this role, please go to:\xa0https://opera.org.au/aboutus/management/employment/jobs.


Company & Production Coordinator: 07/01/2019 to 03/05/2019

The Company & Production Coordinator is responsible for supporting the Assistant Producer: Production and Production Manager in the development and successful implementation of Handa Opera on Sydney Harbour and other projects produced by the team to high artistic and technical standards. The role will coordinate the requirements of the performing company and the production requirements in the rehearsal room and on site.

For more information about this role, please go to: https://opera.org.au/aboutus/management/employment/jobs.


Project Assistant: 28/01/2019 to 10/05/2019

The Project Assistant is responsible for supporting the Assistant Producers in the successful implementation of Handa Opera on Sydney Harbour to high artistic, technical and operational standards. The role will assist with the day-to-day administration to capture all information to be distributed to and from the team.

For more information about this role, please go to: https://opera.org.au/aboutus/management/employment/jobs.


Operations Assistant: 28/01/2019 to 10/05/2019

The Operations Assistant is responsible for supporting the Operations Coordinator in the development and successful implementation of Handa Opera on Sydney Harbour. The role will be responsible for supporting the delivery of operations for production and the site/venue during construction and performance timeframes, including the operational requirements for technical production, site design and the construction and dismantle of the site structures.

For more information about this role, please go to: https://opera.org.au/aboutus/management/employment/jobs.


Site & Communications Officer: 04/02/2019 to 03/05/2019

The Site & Communications Officer is a vital support role and during construction and deconstruction, the Site & Communications Officer will support the operations of the site. During performances, the Site & Communications Officer controls the Communications Room (Emergency Management Centre) during venue operational times. The Site & Communications Officer is experienced in site operations and an experienced radio operator. As the controller of the Communications Room during performance, the role is responsible for recording all communications in accordance with event procedures and policy. It coordinates communication between department supervisors across radio channels, which may involve deploying site resources and implementing emergency response procedures.

For more information about this role, please go to: https://opera.org.au/aboutus/management/employment/jobs.

\xa0

Applications are due by 9.00am on Monday 15 October 2018.


Please provide a cover letter of no more than two A4 pages which addresses the selection criteria and a resume of no more than four A4 pages. If you are interested in more than one role, please provide a separate submission for each role.


Only candidates with full Australian Working Rights are eligible for these roles.


NO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES PLEASE

  • Part of Australia’s fastest growing and largest consumer electronics retailing group
  • Full time and Part time positions available


About us

When the first store opened in Melbourne’s northern suburbs in 1952, The Good Guys’ philosophy was then as it is now – to delight customers and ‘do good’.


From those humble beginnings, The Good Guys quickly became a household name, setting the standard for customer satisfaction and community giving, while continually evolving to meet ever-changing customer needs.


With over 100 stores and more than 3,500 employees nationwide, our Brand promise is to help Australian families live better at home for less.


Now united with JB Hi-Fi Limited, The Good Guys is part of Australia’s fastest growing and largest consumer electronics retailer and a new force in Australian retailing.

\xa0

About you/the role

If you’re someone who is enthusiastic about seizing new opportunities and has a consistent record of achieving results, then we want to hear from you.


We’re looking for Sales Team Members to join us in our exciting new store opening in Moore Park.


You come to us with a proven track record of delivering profitable sales and providing customers with a delightful and memorable experience. With the customer front of mind, you’ll listen attentively and you’re quick to provide solutions that meet their needs. You understand the importance of a positive customer experience and try your best to get the products in their hands with minimal fuss.


You have a can-do attitude and are confident in delivering results despite obstacles and setbacks. Handling tough issues is like a breeze to you and you’re quick to act, always eager to step up to new challenges. You have a natural way of working with others to gain their trust and support. You draw on relationships you’ve built with the team as you work collaboratively towards shared goals.


This is a role where you'll be challenged every day to make a difference in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and will feel a sense of accomplishment in knowing you are making a difference for our customers. You’ll have the opportunity to continuously improve your sales skills and product knowledge through online platforms and supplier training events.


We offer performance-based commissions, great employee discounts and special offers, Novated Leasing, Paid Maternity Leave and we’ll also match every dollar you donate in our Doing Good workplace giving program.

\xa0

To apply

If you are interested in this exciting opportunity with us, please click apply and upload your CV. All applications are strictly confidential.

\xa0

The Good Guys recognises the importance of diversity, and appreciates that different perspectives encourage innovation and create value for our customers.

Job description

#CLOSER #BRAVER #FASTER

The Role

As a mid-level service designer, you will be working on projects that develop quality service experiences contributing to the delivery of customer centric IAG products and services. You will work collaboratively on a wide range of projects using human-centered and participatory design methods facilitating workshops, and developing service blueprints at both a touchpoint and end to end service level. You will work across our brands from innovation to BAU projects supported by a team of cross-discipline designers.

Key Responsibilities
  • Continue to build practical craft and skills in service design and build the team through execution in practice, internal and external networks.
  • Take responsibility for preparing for and documenting the output of design activities, including the support of more junior designers.
  • Source knowledge insights and data from customers, business and analysts identifying root causes and opportunities to develop original concepts.
  • Hold yourself and others accountable for delivering on all commitments escalating systemic problems that are affecting your team performance.
  • Monitor metrics and systems to confirm success, diagnose new opportunities or problems for future iteration.
  • Take time to seek out and understand how the business works. Continually seek ways to understand and communicate the operation of the business and how design can be in service of strategy.
  • Builds relationships with key stakeholders
  • Advise service teams in solving complex problems or issues regarding management, processes, and business systems
  • Understand and apply key frameworks and tools such as journey maps and customer segments.
  • Provide coaching and advice to junior team members in their daily work, supporting the developme

    nt of both their design practice and theory.
  • Help others drive tasks to completion as appropriate.
  • Ensure junior designers understand design team vision, values, tools, methods and approaches.


Skills & Experience
  • Experience preferably gained in a large corporate design team. e.g. Insurance, Financial Service, Customer Service – no need to state actual years
  • Qualifications - Undergraduate degree or advanced diploma in a design related discipline


About Us

At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions. We celebrate and commit to

#Proud to be me – we value difference, not sameness

#Together – harnessing our collective wisdom enables us to be our best for our customers & each other

#No boxes – it's not about labels, boxes or categories. It's about building a diverse and inclusive mindset into everything we do

IAG is the largest general insurance group in Australia and New Zealand, with a growing presence in Asia. IAG owns some of the region's most trusted brands, including NRMA Insurance, CGU, SGIO, SGIC, WFI and Swann Insurance.

Let's Talk

Start your career journey with us and click ‘Apply'!

In addition to a diverse and inclusive culture, some of our benefits include 13% superannuation, 50% insurance discounts, flexible work and leave options, generous parental leave and return to work program, recognition and reward program, and various corporate partner discounts.

We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders to apply for this position.

885689847:

Experience Studio Manager

Company Name McKinsey & Company Company Location Sydney, AU

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 17 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Apply Now

Qualifications
  • 2+ years of management experience in start-ups, high tech, or analytical companies OR familiar with and able to navigate a professional services firm
  • Highly experienced events manager / producer, ideally from a creative, technology or start-up background
  • Self-starter with experience of convening first-class events and project managing multiple activities
  • Acute attention to detail and ideally experienced coordinating function spaces
  • Demonstrated track record of building client capability and impact as well as building and executing media presence
  • Entrepreneurial leader with a passion for client interaction and building strong relationships
  • Agile mindset; comfortable working with multiple stakeholders and priorities
  • Proven experience in applying well developed problem solving skills
  • Strength in technical problem solving with IT systems including Video conferencing, Audio, Visual and supporting software systems (PC, Mac, iOS, Microsoft Surface Hubs, Cruzer)
Who You'll Work With

You’ll work with Digital McKinsey in our Syndey office. Digital McKinsey brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses.

As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and strategy to agile, cloud, cybersecurity, and digital transformation. You’ll typically work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fullyintegrated with the rest of our global firm. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, both on technology and non-technology topics.

Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling themto grow and learn.
What You'll Do

You'll create new ways for audiences to interact with Digital McKinsey’s brand and insights.

You will find strategic and creative ways to link the capabilities of the Studio and Digital McKinsey with our clients, colleagues and selected partner organisations.

In this role you’ll work closely with our Sydney office as well as Digital McKinsey and other groups across the firm, while developing strong client relationships, learning programs, and community impact. You’ll be at the forefront of the McKinsey experiential universe, working with partners and client service teams to understand client challenges. You will walk clients through the future of their business, and reaching out to the community with a cross-section from start-ups to large international players and universities.
You will co-own the success of the studio, not just run it. You will bring the firm on a journey as we move the needle with our stakeholder engagement.

You'll create high impact client experiences, events, workshops, and training initiatives that support and engage with clients as well as help shape the firm’s global strategy around Experience Studios. Coaching teams across the region on best practices for event planning and execution and advising on potential speakers, content, use of technology etc. will also be integral part of your role.

Your work will be fundamental to the Sydney office, and the global digital practice alike. You will build and maintain a calendar of events for a range of stakeholders (internal and external) in collaboration with regional and practice specific Reach & Relevance teams, and leaders. You will co-design client events that showcase McKinsey’s latest capabilities in an experiential way and develop distinctive programming and experiences for our clients (i.e. workshops, community outreach).

Lastly, you will build and manage external partnerships (e.g., Start up community, VCs, Think tanks, Government) to deliver both client impact and extend McKinsey’s reach into the innovation community.

Mid-Senior level

  • Management Consulting

Full-time

  • Information Technology

Environment Protection Officer

Company Name Environment Protection Authority Victoria (EPA) Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About EPA Victoria (EPA)

EPA works on behalf of all Victorians to protect the environment & human health by preventing & reducing pollution & waste.

EPA sets & enforces environmental standards & strives to achieve clean air, healthy waterways, safe land & minimal disturbances from noise & odour for Victorians.

EPA is Victoria's trusted voice on environmental protection for community, industry & Government.

We are recruiting for roles following the Victorian Government's response to the Independent Inquiry into the EPA. These new positions will help EPA meet the challenges posed by a changing climate, growing population & evolving economy.

At EPA you can make a real difference to your career, work-life balance, future & most importantly, our environment.

Environment Protection Officer

Environment Protection Officers are the front line in ensuring that businesses, government and Individuals comply with the Environment Protection Act. They do this by inspecting business and premises, investigating environmental pollution incidents, providing guidance and advice about how to comply, and enforcing the law to deter non-compliance.

The role is critical to EPA operating as both a regulator and influential authority and crucial to the delivery of the annual compliance plan. The role undertakes incident response during business hours and may participate in an after-hour's incident response role by agreement. The role requires sound judgement, strong problem solving skills and a commitment to protecting the environment.

As an EPO you will have;
  • An understanding of environmental management, regulation, law and common industry practices, risks and controls
  • Experience in negotiation, persuasion and motivating internal and external stakeholders when analysing and resolving compliance issues
  • An ability to work well as part of a team and play a positive role in maintaining a constructive culture within the unit

How to Apply: Applicants are invited to apply online via EPA Career Services.

Applicants Should Submit
  • Cover letter; addressing your experience, motivations and suitability to the role
  • Resume; including contact details of two referees
  • Multiple, fixed-term roles available – please indicate if you prefer Melbourne or Dandenong 1 x role is ongoing.

Applications close midnight on Sunday 14 October 2018

For further information on this role, please refer to the attached position description.

All queries in relation to this role should be directed to Steven Pugh, Team Leader - Field on 9695 2961.

All prospective employees are required to undergo a National Criminal Record Check prior to an employment offer being made.
Individual responses to key selection criteria listed on the Position Description are not required.
EPA Victoria is committed to supporting employees through flexible work arrangements and encouraging work/life balance. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and inclusive work environment where all employees are respected, valued and supported. We proactively seek to employ a diverse workforce to leverage the varied ideas of all employees, that drive innovation and success in everything we do.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.
EPA Victoria welcomes applications from serving or past members of the Australian Defence Force.
If you require advice and support with the application process please contact the Recruitment team on 1 300 372 842.
EPA Victoria utilise an Order of Merit process whereby applicants deemed suitable may be retained on a Merit List, from which their application may be accessed for recruitment to similar roles within a 12 month period.
Note: Applications received via e-mail will not be considered.
For further information on Environment Protection Authority Victoria, please visit www.epa.vic.gov.au
